task.title: Staging Mobile Orders
task.shortdesc: The mobile order staging process is used in the dedicated staging area anytime there is a barista deployed to the Mobile Order & Pay (MO&P) station. Depending on the staffing level and the volume of mobile orders, there may be one or two baristas deployed to the MO&P station.

section.title: MO&P Positions and Routines
section.p: When a Hand-Off barista is deployed, the barista will stage mobile orders in the designated staging area. They will also be responsible for working in the Hand-Off Routine, calling out and handing off MO&P and cafe items as they are completed. When another barista is deployed to Support at the MO&P station, they will manage customer items and consolidation in the designated staging area using the Gather and Stage Routine. The Hand-Off barista will work in the Hand-Off Routine, calling out and handing off MO&P, cafe and delivery items as they are completed.
When there are no baristas dedicated to the station, completed MO&P items should be called out and placed on the hand-off plane in the designated space with the label facing out towards the customer.

step.cmd: Call out items as they are ready, hand off to customer if present
If customer is not present, and a Hand-Off barista is deployed, place item on mobile ticket in designated staging area
Organize orders within the fixture or designated staging area, horizontally alphabetically and vertically by quantity in order

section.title: Mobile Order Consolidation
section.p: To make adaptations to the system:

step.cmd: Consider how to minimize the number of times an order needs to be touched
If using a riser, group the riser into sections to help guide baristas to find customer orders quickly
If using the countertop, use the guidelines below to consolidate and organization customer orders
